headline: Ask HN: How far ahead could the NSA be?
description:
For clarity, the NSA or the "classified world" in general, which includes all the corporate entities as well.

Question was prompted by a remark by the following source, to the effect that,

"In the course of my research, I had an acquaintance who worked for the NSA as a civilian during the 1960s, and he offhandedly said they were running computers with a clock speed of 650Mhz at that time."

This source will be poo-pooed by many here I think, because we can probably look up Wikipedia for this person and find words like "debunked", "pseudoscience", "crank", or other such terms of when encountered by many people act like the "Jedi mind trick" and foreshorten any further consideration.

Nevertheless, it seems there could be classified breakthroughs in technology that many years later make their way into the public market. I think it's interesting to speculate how far ahead secret tech could be.

Source: Richard Dolan, Aerial Phenomena with Richard Dolan, S2 Ep8, "Is there a breakaway civilization?"
headline_zh-Hans: Ask HN: 国家安全局能有多大的领先优势？
headline_zh-Hant: Ask HN: 國家安全局能有多大的領先優勢？
description_zh-Hans:
为明确起见，国家安全局或一般的"机密世界"，其中也包括所有的企业实体。

问题是由以下来源的一句话引起的，大意是：

"在我的研究过程中，我有一个熟人在60年代作为平民为国家安全局工作，他不经意地说他们当时运行的计算机的时钟速度为650Mhz。 "

This source will be poo-pooed by many here I think, because we can probably look up Wikipedia for this person and find words like "debunked", "pseudoscience", "crank", or other such terms of when encountered by many people act like the "Jedi mind trick" and foreshorten any further consideration.

Nevertheless, it seems there could be classified breakthroughs in technology that many years later make their way into the public market. I think it's interesting to speculate how far ahead secret tech could be.

Source: Richard Dolan, Aerial Phenomena with Richard Dolan, S2 Ep8, "Is there a breakaway civilization?"
description_zh-Hant:
為明確起見，國家安全局或一般的"機密世界"，其中也包括所有的企業實體。

問題是由以下來源的一句話引起的，大意是：

"在我的研究過程中，我有一個熟人在60年代作為平民為國家安全局工作，他不經意地說他們當時運行的計算機的時鐘速度為650Mhz。 "

This source will be poo-pooed by many here I think, because we can probably look up Wikipedia for this person and find words like "debunked", "pseudoscience", "crank", or other such terms of when encountered by many people act like the "Jedi mind trick" and foreshorten any further consideration.

Nevertheless, it seems there could be classified breakthroughs in technology that many years later make their way into the public market. I think it's interesting to speculate how far ahead secret tech could be.

Source: Richard Dolan, Aerial Phenomena with Richard Dolan, S2 Ep8, "Is there a breakaway civilization?"
